body: for mkl, I think it should be kept with the original (still Apache, but not ASF) license header, and list in NOTICE file http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#required-third-party-notices
Would you like to submit a PR

@fhieber Good question. I'm pretty sure that it would be possible.  On the GPU, the perf always depends on the memory access pattern, with 128-byte contiguous accesses being preferred. But yes, axis change should be doable. That would require another rewrite compared to the current PR, and so would probably be best left for another PR if we are to quickly o ptimize time-major at least. As far as I remember though, there are some things that are only implemented completely for either time-major or batch-major in MxNet anyway, one example being batch-dot. This is especially true for sequence models (TNC vs. NTC), maybe the axis issue is less pronounced in terms of support for images (NCHW vs. NHWC). But yes, I agree, that's a good next step, to support axis selection, for as many operators as possible.
Please show a reproducible example. We don't know what `train` is.

I found that baidu's flac to wav script has bug when it has short duration, it generates repeated sound file as  many 6 times or more. For example sound file was like "Hello is there" then it generates "Hello is there Hello is there Hello is there Hello is there Hello is there Hello is there". And it makes label wrong, and can affect model's performance(both speed and accuracy). So I changed flac to wav converter from avconv to sox, and I found it generates identical outputs but fixes bug. I put fix of fiac_to_wav.sh on https://github.com/samsungsds-rnd/deepspeech.mxnet/commit/ee99375ed5082ec38d03fe0cf30c1c5284edea0c for now. But I am middle of testing because found this bug yesterday with my team member, it may takes time to confirm it doesn't make any unintended effect on model.

I found TBlob and TShape in mshadow namespace. Those are in the mshadow/tensor_blob.h.
The inst_vector.h includes the mshadow/tensor.h and it includes mshadow/tensor_blob.h.
It seems there are no problems however compiler couldn't found codes in mshadow/tensor_blob.h.

Now, I attached this patch file and building libmxnet is runnnig fine.
But I can't explain why original code is failed and why modified is success.
```
diff --git a/src/io/inst_vector.h b/src/io/inst_vector.h
index d82bd48e..faacdf55 100644
--- a/src/io/inst_vector.h
+++ b/src/io/inst_vector.h
@@ -12,6 +12,8 @@
 #include <mxnet/base.h>
 #include <dmlc/base.h>
 #include <mshadow/tensor.h>
+#include <mshadow/tensor_blob.h>
+
 #include <vector>
 #include <string>
```

@piiswrong

I'm wondering if the concatenation of two CSViter results in performance issues from the redundancy of the labels from each CSViter? 

Would it be feasible to have a CSViter reworked so has to have something like a list of CSV files as argument rather than the current fixed `data` and `label`? This would facilitate the use of mixed or multiple data sources. It is something fairly straightforward to perform through R array iter right now, but ability to use a CSV iter would be a nice feature for larger datasets. I'm also thinking that such flexible CSV iter might be used to feed varying length RNN (assuming data has been previously processed into specific CSVs based on their bucket). 

Finally, is it desirable to assume there's an argument named `label`? Just like for other inputs that could be named `user` and `product` rather than `data`, I feel like it would improve model flexibility to have input arguments binded based on whatever arguments are fed by the iter value() rather than on some naming assumptions. 

Anyway, just some personal thoughts; thanks a lot for your work on this!
Thanks for fixing this, I am also impacted by this problem and look forward for your patch.

if you can precompute those conditions. bucketing is a good choice.

NDArray computations are async, when you run a = b + c etc, the op is issued to the engine and returns immediately. `.asnumpy()` is waiting on that computation to be done. You can see this by calling NDArray.wait_to_read() before `.asnumpy()`

Can you run simple things on your gpu like
```
import mxnet as mx
a = mx.nd.zeros((10,10), ctx=mx.gpu(0))
a += 1
print a.asnumpy()
```

If the above works try `export MXNET_CUDNN_AUTOTUNE_DEFAULT=0` to disable cuda tests

This seems to be an issue with MKLML. After rebuilding mxnet with USE_MKL2017=0 I was able to run the char_lstm tutorial.
The workaround is to modify the lines L91 and L127 in src/operator/dropout-inl.h. Here is the [fix](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/6928/files#diff-bceb4cb43fa37cc46d8efa222af1323fL91).
This will be fixed in https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/6673

@piiswrong this is described in [this link](http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#required-third-party-notices)

first, it must not be in category x http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-x

second, for any dependencies or copy of source not from an ASF project (note, this includes Apache 2.0 licenses)
- list it in LICENSE file in different license type groups eg. https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/LICENSE (notice how it referencing the licenses directory)
- for source included, reference the relative file path of each file and list them in the LICENSE file eg. https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/LICENSE
- have a copy of its license under licenses directory eg. https://github.com/apache/spark/tree/master/licenses
- for any source include, its original header or licensing information is kept as-is (do not change to Apache/ASF header
- for some, addition attribution in a NOTICE file is required: http://www.apache.org/dev/licensing-howto.html#mod-notice (basically any project that has NOTICE file should carry the content over, plus some other conditions like re-licensing)

hope that helps

I don't know why the following chunk of code is not moved inside `PushAsync(lambda, ...)` 
```
// push to servers
   size_t size = send_buf.shape().Size();
   #if MKL_EXPERIMENTAL == 1
   mkl_set_tblob_eager_mode(send_buf.data());
   #endif
   real_t* data = static_cast<real_t*>(send_buf.data().dptr_)
```
If it is moved inside the lambda, the `WaitToRead()` call is not necessary. 
Otherwise you need to wait to read since you're accessing `send_buf.data()`

@Shiro-mx I suggest you to use the module api which is more flexible. The triplet loss example shows how to share weight between nets by define the weight variable with specific name, and use them in both nets.

1. Why when add waittoread() , all the param_arrays will be clocked until all the backward convolution finished? The param in one layer can't push to kvstore directly after this layers' backward compute.
We can Observe this phenomenon by using profiler when training a image classificcation model,such as resnet.
2. The 'data' used in lamda is a real_t pointer. In the PushAsync, 'send_buf' is a const_var. It will wait send_buf to read before process the lamda function. So when the program process the lamda function the pointer 'data' can point to sendbuf.data() which can be read. Why we need add 'send_buf.WaitToRead();' before?

Would you provide some error message or  
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH by below command (Please fill out the /path/to/ to your actual path)
```
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/path/to/warp-ctc/build:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
```
then rerun the toy_ctc.py?
I will appreciate if someone can tell me if the speed I am getting is as expected.
